revised_title: Investigating the Displacement of Chlorides from Solution by Alcohol and Hydrogen Chloride
tldr: This study investigates the displacement of chlorides from solution by alcohol and hydrogen chloride, focusing on the solubility of sodium chloride and potassium chloride. The authors find that alcohol and hydrogen chloride have different effects on the solubility of chlorides, with alcohol being a weaker dehydrant and hydrogen chloride a stronger one. The results suggest that the degree of dissociation of a dissolved salt is influenced by the presence of compounds containing its ions.
